settings.heading: What is the UTR Pro Tennis Tour?
Pro Tennis Tour Wild Card Tournaments

settings.description: The UTR Pro Tennis Tour events are really great to add to my schedule when match play is needed. But they also provide amazing prize money for all rounds of the event, which is crucial to be able to support my tennis.
settings.author: Destanee Aiava

settings.description: UTR [Sports] just did a huge step forward, where it attracts a lot more pro players on tour, and everyone just wants to get into it and play... I highly recommend for everyone to join.
settings.author: Veronika Miroshnichenko

settings.description: The way it's structured is great because it’s a minimum of three or four matches, and high-level players come in... When I first played PTT, I got absolutely stumped. The guys were so good.
settings.author: Alex Michelsen
settings.author-designation: Two-time PTT champion, Top 40 in ATP

settings.description: You have the ability with a round robin to play multiple matches... I think it's amazing because at least you get the chance to get to see where you're at and to keep playing.
settings.author: Taylor Townsend
settings.author-designation: Two-time women's doubles Grand Slam champion

settings.description: [UTR Sports] definitely helped a lot, especially when I first started, and I needed a lot of matches. The prize money and level of play were good... It's a good way to improve and get a lot of matches under your belt.
settings.author: Li Tu
settings.author-designation: Two-time PTT champion, faced Carlos Alcaraz at 2024 US Open

settings.description: With the introduction of PTT events, UTR Sports has changed the game. Having weeklong events allows our players to get several high-end matches necessary for their development.
settings.author: Peter Kobelt
settings.author-designation: Head Men's Tennis Coach, University of Nebraska

Where can I find UTR Pro Tennis Tour Rules and Regulations?
settings.row_content:
All players are encouraged to read the PTT Rules and Regulations, including the Code of Conduct. These are available on the links below:

UTR Pro Tennis Tour (PTT) Rules and Regulations

UTR Pro Tennis Tour Code of Conduct

settings.heading: What's the UTR Pro Tennis Tour format?
settings.row_content:
16 Draw Format:
The 16 person main draw will consist of 4 groups of 4 players each. All matches will be best of 3 tie-break sets with regular scoring. The Main Draw will consist of 12 Direct Acceptances and 4 Wild Cards. The round-robin main draw group stages will run from day 1 to day 2 where each player will have three matches across two days. The Playoff Rounds will be single elimination and consist of 4 draws of 4 players depending on the player’s group finishing (1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th) and will run from day 3 to day 4. The players eliminated in the semifinal will face each other in a 3rd/4th final of the relevant Playoff. All matches will be best of 3 tie-break sets with regular scoring.

20 Draw Format:
The 20 person main draw will consist of 4 groups of 5 players each. The round-robin group stages will run from Monday to Friday. All matches will be best of 3 tie break sets with regular scoring. The Main Draw will consist of 16 Direct Acceptances and 4 Wild Cards. The Playoff Rounds will be single elimination and consist of five draws of 4 players depending on the player’s group finishing (1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th, or 5th) and will run from Saturday to Sunday. All matches will be best of 3 tie break sets with regular scoring.

32 Draw Format:
The main draw (singles only) will consist of 8 groups of 4 players each. The round-robin group stages will run from Sunday to Wednesday. All matches will be best 3 tie break sets with regular scoring. The Playoff Rounds will be single elimination and consist of three draws of 8 players depending on the player's group finishing (1st, 2nd, or 3rd) and will run from Thursday to Sunday. All matches will be best 2 out of 3 sets, regular scoring. A one-round Qualifying will be held on Sunday and all matches will be best 2 out of 3 sets, regular scoring. The losers in qualifying can sign in for Lucky Loser throughout the round-robin group stages.

For more detailed information, please see the Tournament Format document.

settings.heading: Who is eligible to participate in the UTR Pro Tennis Tour $25K?
settings.row_content:
Male players must have a UTR of at least 12.5 and be outside the top 200 PTT ranking. Women must have a minimum UTR of 9.7 and be outside the top 200 PTT ranking.

Players ranked 1-200 or outside the top 2000 will only be accepted with a wild card approved by UTR. All other eligible players will be placed in the alternates list and entry fees refunded.

OPEN COMPETITION
UTR Pro Tennis Tour $25K tournaments are open to all tennis players based on merit and without discrimination. Minors under the age of fourteen (14) shall not be eligible for Entry. For the purposes of these Regulations, the player’s age as of the Monday of the Tournament Week shall be used.

settings.heading: How do I activate my UTR profile and register for the UTR Pro Tennis Tour?
settings.row_content:
In order to activate your profile, scroll up to “Activate your profile” and search your name - you’ll be able to activate your profile from your profile page. Having issues? Contact our support team.

Please see our step by step guide on how to activate a player profile and register for a PTT event here.

settings.heading: Can you explain the UTR Pro Tennis Tour deadlines?
settings.row_content:
All entries and withdrawals PRIOR to the registration deadline must be submitted online through the player’s account. Withdrawals AFTER the registration deadline must be made via email to ptt@universaltennis.com and resulting fines will be administered according to the Rules and Regulations summarized below:

Late Withdrawals Prior to Freeze Deadline: $500 and up to a potential one-month suspension from all UTR events

Late Withdrawals After Freeze Deadline: $750 and up to a potential one-month suspension from all UTR events

No Show: Minimum $1,000 and up to a two month suspension from all UTR events

Playing another event: $1,000 and up to a two month suspension from all UTR events

settings.heading: Can I participate in another event in the same week?
settings.row_content:
When a player is accepted into the Qualifying or Main Draw of a Tournament as Direct Acceptance or Wild Card at any time after the Registration Deadline they are Committed to that PTT tournament, without exception.

A player who is committed to and/or has played in the Main Draw or Qualifying of a PTT tournament may not enter or compete in any other tennis event during the period of such tournament, without exception.

Players may not be accepted into any other tournaments during the same week. Players will be withdrawn from all but one Tournament at the Withdrawal Deadline based on the withdrawal procedure described above. If a player is found after the Withdrawal Deadline to have been accepted into two Tournaments in one week, they will be withdrawn from one Tournament at the earliest opportunity, also according to the withdrawal procedure set out above.

Playing another event will result in a $1,000 fine and up to a two month suspension from all UTR events.

settings.heading: How will I get paid?
settings.row_content: UTR Sports will pay the prize money to all players participating in the Tournament in accordance with the UTR Pro Tennis Tour prize money breakdowns (“Prize Money”), unless otherwise noted. Universal Tennis will make prize money payable by bank transfer available to eligible players.

settings.heading: I am travelling to a tournament. What arrangements should I make in advance?
settings.row_content:
Prior to departing for a tournament, a player should do the following:

1. Check relevant travel and security information about the country you are traveling to.

Examples: https://www.iatatravelcentre.com/world.php

2. It is recommended that players obtain travel insurance to cover flight cancellations and other disruptions in travel.

3. Print all relevant tournament information, such as tournament site address, phone number, the PTT PM and head referee number, hotel address and contact number, etc.

4. Confirm the appropriate Visa has been obtained and all necessary Travel Documents.

settings.heading: How do I handle threats, offensive and unwanted messages?
settings.row_content: If you are receiving any emails, SMS messages, Facebook, Twitter or other social media messages and/or images that you are concerned about, send a copy of the message, screenshot and the URL to ptt@universaltennis.com or talk to a member of onsite venue staff, ideally the Referee or TD for assistance. For any betting-related messages, please send to integrity@universaltennis.com. Universal Tennis takes player safety seriously and has a policy to report all hostile messages sent to players to authorities with jurisdiction over such matters as well as we take steps to identify the messenger immediately. Learn more about PTT Social Media Safety.
